body.p:
Auburn Ky. June 5^th^/61
Dr. J. B. Payton

Dr. Sir -- A Company of Home Guards was organised at Auburn on Saturday last in accordance with the recent act of the Ky, Legislature -- The company sent John biers to Frankfort on Monday 3rd June to procure arms, but was refused on account of the Board of Coms -- not having acted -- We wish you to do what you can for us, and if the Guns can be spared we will be glad to get them and will take such as you may select --
If the Guns are not on hand we will continue to drill without arms, if we can get assurances of being supplied hereafter -- I will forward a good Bond immediately if required --

I have been elected Captain, J H wood, David Mcauley & E, H, Slop Lieutenants & we have about 80 members including such men as Jno Daily Jno, G Lewis Dr Ray W D Price R, Woodward Jno biers William McCutchen & about 50 young men --

Our proximity to an abolition settlement & being on the R. Road with other good reasons
renders it very desirable that we should be armed
anything you may find it convenient to do for us in this matter will be most thankfully recd --

By yours
most Respectfullly
C, H, Blakey
